tweets.text:
UPDATE: The Flood Alert issued last night by @EnvAgencyYNE for the Upper Calder is no longer in force.

River levels may remain a little elevated throughout the day today, but have now fallen below levels of concern. https://t.co/pnZXOqqzIs

Another of our #StonebridgeLock #LeeNavigation wild waterbirds rescued from a slow death of starvation&hypothermia due to entanglement in #fishing tackle *warning details in thread @EnvAgency time the extra rod licence fees went to rescues dealing with this problem @natalieben https://t.co/d1OY6Sb12o

tweets.text:
We have now re-opened phase 1 & 2 flood gates at Yarm.

These were closed yesterday due to increased rainfall in the area & rising river levels on the #RiverTees 

For all of the latest information about flood alerts and warnings visit: https://t.co/GEqDRnfqgA #flooding https://t.co/Zj7gw7sxhb

This evening we operated the riverside flood gates along the River #Ouse in #York to help reduce flood risk to local properties after recent rainfall and melting snow increased local river levels. Learn more about flood alerts and warnings web-link https://t.co/GEqDRnfqgA https://t.co/87xGk3uZOh

In a joint message, @TonyJuniper from @NaturalEngland,
@EmmaHowardBoyd from @EnvAgency and @williamrworsley from @ForestryEngland have declared that this must be the year we ramp up action on climate change and #NatureRecovery.

#TogetherForOurPlanet
https://t.co/imv3CfNn6I

urls.title: Chinese nuclear firm told it must resolve Bradwell safety issues
urls.description: Disposal of radioactive waste is one of six issues to be addressed before plant in Essex can go ahead

tweets.text:
@EnvAgency has told @CGNBradwellB - the Chinese nuclear developer behind plans to build a new reactor in Essex - that it must resolve at least six safety issues before it can move forward.
https://t.co/hFUr23NtW7 https://t.co/9L5UwBG2RY

tweets.text:
Fishing is allowed in the #coronavirus lockdown if you adhere to the rules & stay local, limit this to once a day, no overnight fishing & keep to social distancing

Enforcement Officers are patrolling the #BurtonOnTrent area including here in #Alrewas at the Trent & Mersey canal https://t.co/VXxM5fN0l5

domain.name: Ongoing News Story
domain.description: Ongoing News Stories like 'Brexit'

tweets.text:
#TeamEA have been trimming over hanging tree limbs to free up the river flow against blockages at Witherslack  #Cumbria

Notice something in your local watercourse that does not look right? Report it too us on 0800 80 70 60 https://t.co/J57IbJtBe9

Illegal waste carriers undermine legitimate businesses, undercut their prices and blight the #environment

You may also be prosecuted for letting them take your waste so always check their credentials online here - 
https://t.co/IzkQHCXIeA

#WasteCrime https://t.co/PZk80pM7iV

UPDATE: Following extensive enquiries, we have identified the likely source of this oil and are working with the site owner to ensure no further oil is released and the spill site and surrounding drains are remediated.  #Norwich #RiverYare https://t.co/g3VjshKeNf

Our fisheries teams were busy in December stocking mixed coarse fish reared @FishFarmEA into Woodrow's Pond #DarleyAbbey #Derbyshire 

Income from #FishingLicence fees is used to restore, improve & develop sustainable fisheries.

Have you got yours? https://t.co/f5iTBUKpsS https://t.co/N5r6K5deT3

As part of our role in scrutinising nuclear power station designs alongside @The_ONR, we have today launched a consultation on our General Design Assessment of the UK Hualong Pressurised water Reactor (UK HPR1000). 

Read more here: https://t.co/S69nPMSTKt

So the @EnvAgency has published its annual report, 5 months late.

Apparently they "Have achieved a huge amount over the last year", obviously including, not a single river in England reaches 'Good' overall environmental health.

Spent ¬£1.431 billion and employed 10,229 staff. https://t.co/0aEhhtaw8p

Due to increased rain fall in the area and rising river levels on the #RiverTees we have closed phase 1 & 2 flood gates at #Yarm We have also issued a flood alert for the Lower River Tees. For all of the latest information about flood alerts and warnings https://t.co/GEqDRnfqgA https://t.co/iIQOZEwvon

tweets.text:
Reminder to residents & business owners in #TenburyWells - visit our online engagement room before the end of Jan & find out about your flood risk management scheme

Two facilitated phone calls arranged for 26 & 28 January for those without internet access https://t.co/GY8WvQgmob

On 11/01/21 at 20:15 the river level was 2.09m and above its typical range. https://t.co/QgHefMZojf
